title: Daniel's Vision of Four Beasts
shortSummary: Daniel 7 reveals a prophetic vision given to Daniel during the reign of Belshazzar, depicting four great beasts rising from the sea, symbolizing successive earthly kingdoms. The chapter culminates with the eternal kingdom being given to the 'Son of man' and the saints of the Most High, affirming God's sovereign judgment and everlasting dominion.
timeline: c. 550 BC - During the Babylonian Empire under King Belshazzar

keyCharacters.name: Daniel
keyCharacters.description: A prophet and servant of God who receives and records the vision of the four beasts and the coming eternal kingdom.

keyCharacters.name: Ancient of Days
keyCharacters.description: A divine figure representing God the Father who presides over judgment and the eternal kingdom.

keyCharacters.name: Son of man
keyCharacters.description: A messianic figure who receives everlasting dominion, glory, and a kingdom from the Ancient of Days.

keyCharacters.name: Little horn
keyCharacters.description: A symbolic horn arising among ten horns on the fourth beast, representing a blasphemous and persecuting power opposing God's saints.

definitions.definition: Symbolic creatures representing kingdoms or empires that arise on earth, often characterized by their strength and ferocity.
A title for God emphasizing His eternal existence, wisdom, and authority as judge over all creation.
A Messianic title referring to a heavenly figure who receives authority and an everlasting kingdom from God.
Symbolic of ten kings or rulers arising from the fourth kingdom, representing political powers or kingdoms.

definitions.term: Time, times, and dividing of time
definitions.definition: A prophetic phrase indicating a limited period of persecution or trial, often understood as three and a half years.

outline.heading: Daniel’s Vision of the Four Beasts
outline.description: Daniel describes a night vision where four distinct beasts emerge from the sea, each symbolizing successive kingdoms with unique characteristics, including a little horn that speaks arrogantly and uproots three others.

outline.heading: The Judgment Scene
outline.description: Daniel sees the Ancient of Days seated on a fiery throne, executing judgment against the fourth beast, which is destroyed by fire, while the other beasts lose their dominion but continue to live temporarily.

outline.heading: The Son of Man and Everlasting Kingdom
outline.description: One like the Son of man approaches the Ancient of Days and is given eternal dominion, glory, and a kingdom that will never be destroyed, highlighting the ultimate triumph of God's kingdom.

outline.heading: Daniel’s Distress and Request for Interpretation
outline.description: Daniel expresses his deep distress over the vision and seeks understanding from a heavenly messenger who provides the interpretation of the beasts and the prophetic timeline.

outline.heading: Interpretation of the Vision
outline.description: The four beasts represent four kings or kingdoms; the little horn is a blasphemous ruler who persecutes the saints until divine judgment removes his power, and the kingdom is given to the saints of the Most High forever.

application: Trust in God's sovereign control over earthly kingdoms and history, knowing that His eternal kingdom will ultimately prevail.
Remain faithful and steadfast in the face of persecution, as the saints will inherit the everlasting kingdom.
Seek understanding through prayer and Scripture when confronted with troubling visions or circumstances.
Recognize the authority of Christ, the Son of man, and submit to His everlasting dominion in all areas of life.

keyVerses.text: And there was given him dominion, and glory, and a kingdom, that all people, nations, and languages, should serve him: his dominion is an everlasting dominion, which shall not pass away, and his kingdom that which shall not be destroyed.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms the eternal and universal reign of the Messiah, providing hope and assurance of God's ultimate victory.

keyVerses.text: But the saints of the most High shall take the kingdom, and possess the kingdom for ever, even for ever and ever.
keyVerses.significance: It promises believers an eternal inheritance in God's kingdom, encouraging perseverance and faithfulness.

keyVerses.text: And he shall speak great words against the most High, and shall wear out the saints of the most High, and think to change times and laws: and they shall be given into his hand until a time and times and the dividing of time.
keyVerses.significance: This highlights the persecution believers may face but also the limited duration of such trials under God's sovereign plan.

keyVerses.text: And the kingdom and dominion, and the greatness of the kingdom under the whole heaven, shall be given to the people of the saints of the most High, whose kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions shall serve and obey him.
keyVerses.significance: It underscores the final victory and eternal reign of God's people, reinforcing the hope of ultimate redemption and authority.
